ip_address.description:
The customers IP address.

**Required for:** Pay later, credit card, and Payment Component orders for our fraud check. If empty or incorrect (e.g. your IP address instead of the customers), the transaction status may be **Uncleared**, or even **Declined**.


**Recommended** but not required for other payment methods.

To retrieve the customer's IP address if there is:
- A proxy, use `forwarded_ip`.
- No proxy, use `ip_address`.

forwarded_ip.description:
The [X-Forwarded-For](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/X-Forwarded-For) header of the customer object when using a proxy.

To retrieve the customer's IP address if there is:
- A proxy, use `forwarded_ip`.
- No proxy, use `ip_address`.

first_name.description:
The customers first name.

We recommend always requiring the customer to provide their full name, instead of initials or abbreviations.

address1.description: The first line of the address.

address2.description: The second line of the address.

house_number.description: The house number of the address.

zip_code.description: The ZIP code of the address.

state.description:
The state of the address. 

**Required for:** PayPal Seller Protection

country.description:
The country of the address.

**Required for:** Bank Transfer and PayPal Seller Protection

email.description:
The customers email address.

Used for [Second Chance](https://docs.multisafepay.com/features/second-chance/) emails and fraud checks.

**Required for:** Bank Transfer

user_agent.description: The characteristic string that identifies the customer's browser.
user_agent.example: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.3; WOW64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/38.0.2125.111 Safari/537.36

referrer.description: The unique identifier for where the customer/browser originates from.

reference.description:
Your unique client-defined identifier for your customer.

**Required for:** [Recurring payments](https://docs.multisafepay.com/api/#recurring-payments-orders) orders, both initial and subsequent payments.

gateway_info.description:
Information specific to the payment method (gateway). 

**Required for:**

- Credit and debit card orders
- Apple Pay, Google Pay, and SEPA Direct Debit direct orders
- Bancontact QR and iDEAL QR orders
- AfterPay, E-Invoicing, in3, Klarna, and Pay After Delivery orders for credit checks in the Netherlands and Belgium
- [Flexible 3D orders](https://docs.multisafepay.com/features/3d-secure/flexible/)
- [MOTO orders](https://docs.multisafepay.com/features/moto/)

card_number.description: The credit or debit card number.

card_cvc.description:
The card verification code (CVC)  a 3 or 4 digit number used as an additional security feature for card-not-present transactions.  

**Required for:** All credit and debit card payments, **except** for Maestro and [Recurring payments](https://docs.multisafepay.com/features/recurring-payments/)

flexible_3d.description: For Flexible 3D orders (**required**), whether or not 3D Secure authentication is required.

moto.description: For MOTO orders (**required**), whether to create a MOTO order.

term_url.description: For Flexible 3D orders (**required**), the URL that tells the card issuer where to redirect the authentication query.

issuer_id.description:
The unique identifier of the gateway issuer.

**Required for:** `direct` orders

payment_token.description:
**Required for:** Apple Pay `direct` orders, the JSON-encoded `payment.token` with the customers encrypted payment details, generated by the Apple Pay JS API.


See:

- Apple Pay direct integration  [Create an order](https://docs.multisafepay.com/payments/methods/wallet/applepay/direct-integration/#client-side-integration-1) 
- Apple Developer  [ApplePayPaymentToken](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/apple_pay_on_the_web/applepaypaymenttoken)

**Required for:** Google Pay `direct` orders, the payment token returned from the client-side Google Pay API request.


Access the token at `PaymentData.PaymentMethodData.PaymentMethodTokenizationData.token`.


See [Google Pay direct integration](https://docs.multisafepay.com/payments/methods/wallet/googlepay/direct-integration/).

qr_size.description:
For iDEAL QR orders, sets the width and height of the QR image in pixels. 


Sizes are between 100 and 2000 pixels. If the value does not meet this rule, the default is used.


Default: 250 (250 by 250 pixels).

allow_multiple.description: For iDEAL QR orders, sets whether the QR code can be used more than once.

allow_change_amount.description:
For iDEAL QR orders, sets whether the customer can change the amount to pay. 

You must then also set `min_amount` and `max_amount`.

min_amount.description:
For iDEAL QR orders, sets a minimum amount that the customer must pay.


The `min_amount` must be lower than the `amount`.


If `min_amount` is not set, but `max_amount` is set, then the `amount` value is used as the `min_amount`.


**Required if:** `allow_change_amount` is set to true.

max_amount.description:
For iDEAL QR orders, sets a maximum amount that the customer can pay.


The `max_amount` must be higher than the `amount`.


If `max_amount` is not set, but `min_amount` is set, then the `amount` value is used as the `max_amount`.


**Required if:** `allow_change_amount` is set to true.

account_id.description: For SEPA Direct Debit `direct` orders (**required**), the international bank account number (IBAN).

account_holder_name.description: For SEPA Direct Debit `direct` orders (**required**), the name of the account holder.

account_holder_iban.description: For SEPA Direct Debit `direct` orders (**required**), the international bank account number (IBAN).

emandate.description: For SEPA Direct Debit `direct` orders (**required**), the unique emandate identifier (for your own administration).

birthday.description: For pay later orders (**required**), the customers date of birth.

bank_account.description: For pay later orders (**required**), the customers international bank account number (IBAN).

phone.description: For pay later orders (**required**), the customer's phone number.

email.description: For pay later orders (**required**), the customer's email address to send payment instructions to.

allOf.description: The customer's shipping address.

first_name.description:
The customers first name.

We recommend always requiring the customer to provide their full name, instead of initials or abbreviations.

address1.description: The first line of the address.

house_number.description: The apartment number of the address.

zip_code.description: The ZIP code of the address.

country.description: The country of the address.

allOf.description: Settings for the shopping cart, including taxes and validation.

validate_cart.description:
If set to `true`, the value of `amount` is compared to the calculated total value of the shopping cart (returned as `order_total`).

If the values:

- Match, the request is successful.
- Dont match, the request is unsuccessful and error_code 1027 is returned.

tax_tables.description: Sets default VAT settings and creates VAT classes in the alternate array, which you can apply to individual shopping cart items.

default.description: The default VAT setting. Used when no value is set for `shopping_cart.items.tax_table_selector`.

shipping_taxed.description: Sets whether or not the shipping costs are taxed.

rate.description: The tax rate percentage as a fraction, e.g. 15% is expressed as `0.15`.

alternate.description: An array of client-defined VAT classes that you can apply to items in the shopping cart.

name.description: The client-defined ID. Applies tax settings to items in the shopping cart through the `shopping_cart.items.tax_table_selector` attribute.

standalone.description: Sets whether or not the shipping costs are taxed.

rate.description: The tax rate percentage expressed as a fraction.

country.description: The country where the tax rate applies.

shopping_cart.description:
The array of items in the customer's shopping cart, including the tax class as defined in `checkout_options`.

If you have a self-made integration, include the complete specification of the `shopping_cart`.

items.description: The items in the customer's shopping cart. Specify the relevant tax ruling per item.

name.description: The name of the product or service.

description.description: A description of the product or service.

unit_price.description:
The unit price (in decimals) of the item, excluding VAT.

The currency of the shopping cart is set at order level using `currency`. 

**Example:** The value for a 90 backpack is `90`.

quantity.description: The number of units of the item.

merchant_item_id.description:
Your unique (client-defined) identifier for the product or service.

If this item specifies the shipping costs, set to `msp-shipping`.

tax_table_selector.description: Your client-defined identifier for a tax table, specified as `checkout_options.tax_tables.alternate.name`.

value.description:
The weight of the item corresponding to the unit.

For a 2 kilogram product:
- Set `value` to `2`.
- Set `unit` to `KG`.

items.description: An HTML string to display the order items on the MultiSafepay payment page, instead of including a `shopping_cart`.

payload.description:
The response to the `getPaymentData()` Payment Component method.

See Payment Component integration manual  Step 3: Create an order:

- [Single payment method](https://docs.multisafepay.com/payment-components/single/step-3/)
- [Multiple payment methods](https://docs.multisafepay.com/payment-components/multiple/step-3/)

gateway.description: The unique gateway identifier for the payment method.

recurring_model.description:
For initial and subsequent [Recurring payments](https://docs.multisafepay.com/features/recurring-payments/) (**required**), sets the recurring model:

- Card on file (COF): The cardholder has authorized you to store their card details.
- Subscription: An agreement or services that are billed at the end of your billing cycle, e.g. weekly, monthly.
- Unscheduled: Event-triggered, e.g. mobile top-up when no credit left on the phone.

recurring_id.description: For subsequent [Recurring payments](https://docs.multisafepay.com/features/recurring-payments/) (**required**), the unique identifier of the recurring payment.

split_payments.description:
Split the amount of a transaction between partner/primary and affiliated accounts by a percentage, a fixed amount, or both.

For every split payment rule, add an object to the array.

merchant.description: The account ID of the affiliated account.

fixed.description: The amount to split in cents.

percentage.description: A percentage of the amount to split.

description.description: A description of the split payment.

send_mail.description:
Whether to send reminder emails if the customer doesn't complete payment.


 **Suppressing Second Chance emails after cancellation**


 When a customer places an order, goes to your checkout, doesnt complete payment, but later returns and tries to pay again, some webshops create a second order. 
 
 
 If Second Chance emails are enabled, the customer still receives emails for the first order, even after they complete payment for the second order.

 Cancelling the first order does **not** suppress Second Chance emails. To suppress emails, make an Update order details: CancelOrder request.

html.description:
If 3D Secure authentication is:

- Required: An HTML form is returned. You can either render the form and redirect the customer to it to pass authentication, or redirect them to the `payment_url` (recommended).
- Not required: The [transaction status](https://docs.multisafepay.com/about-payments/multisafepay-statuses/) response is processed directly and no HTML form is returned.

type.description: The type of response returned, i.e. a form.

days_active.description:
For `redirect` and `paymentlink` orders, sets the number of days the link to the MultiSafepay payment page is valid.

The link lifetime begins when the order is created, or the link is generated. A `session_id` is returned in the payment page URL.

If [Second Chance](https://docs.multisafepay.com/features/second-chance/) is enabled, we recommend a minimum lifetime of **48 hours**. Second Chance emails the customer 2 payment reminders: 1 hour and 24 hours after the order is created. If the lifetime is less than 24 hours, the link in the second email is no longer active when the customer receives it. 

See `seconds_active` below. If `seconds_active` is also set, `seconds_active` is used. If neither is set, the default is used.

seconds_active.description:
For `redirect` and `paymentlink` orders, sets the number of seconds the link to the MultiSafepay payment page is valid.

See `days_active` above. If `days_active` is also set, `seconds_active` is used. If neither is set, the default is used.

post.description:
Process a [full or partial refund](https://docs.multisafepay.com/refunds/full-partial/) for an order.

Refunding creates a new order (with its own order ID) linked to the original order. 

To refund pay later orders, see `RefundPayLater`.

parameters.name: order_id
parameters.description:
The unique identifier of the order. 

Max length: 50 characters.

currency.description: The currency to process the refund in. This must be the same as the original transaction.

amount.description:
The refund amount in the currency's smallest unit.

- Decimal currencies: Value for 10 EUR = 1000 (1000 cents) 
- Zero-decimal currencies: Value for 10 YEN = 10

**Note:** A `0` amount triggers a full refund. Use if you don't know the current balance of the transaction.

description.description: A description of the customer's order. Appears on MultiSafepay payment pages and customer bank statements (if supported by the bank)

refund_order_id.description: Set a unique identifier for the refund.

var3.description: Variable for storing additional data, including [Split Payments](https://docs.multisafepay.com/features/split-payments/) metadata.

checkout_data.description:
Contains:

- All of the items and quantities of the original order's array of `item` objects
- Duplicate `item` objects of the items to be refunded (with negative quantity)

To retrieve the original order's array of `item` objects, make a `GET /orders/{order_id}` request.

name.description: The name of the product or service.

description.description: A description of the product or service.

unit_price.description:
The unit price (in decimals) of the item, excluding VAT.

The currency of the shopping cart is set at order level using `currency`. 

**Example:** The value for a 90 backpack is `90`.

quantity.description: The number of units of the item.

merchant_item_id.description:
Your unique (client-defined) identifier for the product or service.

If this item specifies the shipping costs, set to `msp-shipping`.

tax_table_selector.description: Your client-defined identifier for a tax table, specified as `checkout_options.tax_tables.alternate.name`.

value.description:
The weight of the item corresponding to the unit.

For a 2 kilogram product:
- Set `value` to `2`.
- Set `unit` to `KG`.

success.description: Indicates whether the request was successful.

transaction_id.description: MultiSafepay's unique identifier for the transaction (also known as the PSP ID).

refund_id.description: MultiSafepay's unique identifier for the refund transaction (also known as the PSP ID).

success.description: False

get.description:
List all of a customer's [tokens](https://docs.multisafepay.com/features/recurring-payments/). 

To paginate the response, use the `limit` and `offset` query parameters.

parameters.name: your_customer_reference
parameters.description: Your unique identifier of the customer.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description:
The number of tokens you want to list.

If empty, the default is 10.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description:
The number of the token to start the list from.

If empty, the default is 0, i.e. the first token.

success.description: Indicates whether the request was successful.

items.description: Information about the token.

token.description: The unique identifier of the token.

code.description: The unique identifier of the payment gateway.

display.description: How the card number is displayed.

expired.description: Whether the card has expired. If `1`, the card has expired. If `0`, the card is valid.

last4.description: The last 4 digits of the card number.

model.description:
For initial and subsequent [Recurring payments](https://docs.multisafepay.com/features/recurring-payments/) (**required**), sets the recurring model:

- Card on file (COF): The cardholder has authorized you to store their card details.
- Subscription: An agreement or services that are billed at the end of your billing cycle, e.g. weekly, monthly.
- Unscheduled: Event-triggered, e.g. mobile top-up when no credit left on the phone.

success.description: `false`
